identificationModule.briefTitle: Meditation and Education That is Nurse Delivered for Symptom Management in Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation (PAF)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Mindfulness Meditation and Patient Education for Symptom Management in Individuals With Atrial Fibrillation(AF): Do They Need to Be Offered Together?

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of this project is to determine whether the entire intervention (Mindfulness meditation, AF education, and weekly phone visits) that is nurse delivered to individuals with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation is more effective than a combination, single or no intervention in the reduction of overall AF symptoms, anxiety, and negative illness perception; or the improvement of quality of life (QOL) and functional status.

armGroups.label: Usual Care
armGroups.description: patient receives same care as patients not enrolled in study intervention

armGroups.label: AF education
armGroups.description: Participant receives 6 modules of AF education topics that are intended to be completed consecutively, one each week.

armGroups.label: Mindfulness Meditation Practice
armGroups.description: Each participant watches an mindfulness meditation introductory video in the initial session and then is asked to practice for 10 minutes each day using a guided audio, which includes a different topic each week. The time duration of the guided meditations increases to 15 minutes each day during Weeks 3-6.

armGroups.label: Weekly Phone Calls
armGroups.description: Each week for the six-week intervention, the researcher will contact the participant by phone at an agreed upon time and will discuss any questions, issues or concerns that are voiced by the participant within 5-15 minutes.

armGroups.label: AF Education and Mindfulness Meditation
armGroups.description: Participant receives 6 modules of AF education topics that are intended to be completed consecutively, one each week. Each participant watches an mindfulness meditation introductory video in the initial session and then is asked to practice for 10 minutes each day using a guided audio, which includes a different topic each week. The time duration of the guided meditations increases to 15 minutes each day during Weeks 3-6.

armGroups.description: Participant receives 6 modules of AF education topics that are intended to be completed consecutively, one each week. Each week for the six-week intervention, the researcher will contact the participant by phone at an agreed upon time and will discuss any questions, issues or concerns that are voiced by the participant within 5-15 minutes.

armGroups.description: Each participant watches an mindfulness meditation introductory video in the initial session and then is asked to practice for 10 minutes each day using a guided audio, which includes a different topic each week. The time duration of the guided meditations increases to 15 minutes each day during Weeks 3-6. Each week for the six-week intervention, the researcher will contact the participant by phone at an agreed upon time and will discuss any questions, issues or concerns that are voiced by the participant within 5-15 minutes.

armGroups.label: Meditation and Education and Phone Calls
armGroups.description: Each participant watches an mindfulness meditation introductory video in the initial session and then is asked to practice for 10 minutes each day using a guided audio, which includes a different topic each week. Participant receives 6 modules of AF education topics that are intended to be completed consecutively, one each week. The time duration of the guided meditations increases to 15 minutes each day during Weeks 3-6. Each week for the six-week intervention, the researcher will contact the participant by phone at an agreed upon time and will discuss any questions, issues or concerns that are voiced by the participant within 5-15 minutes.

interventions.name: Meditation
interventions.description: Guided Meditation for 10-15 minutes daily for 6 days/week for 6 weeks
armGroupLabels: Meditation and Education and Phone Calls

interventions.name: AF Education
interventions.description: 6 weekly education modules on topics related to AF
armGroupLabels: AF Education and Weekly Phone Calls
Meditation and Education and Phone Calls

interventions.name: Phone Calls
interventions.description: Weekly phone call to discuss patient concerns or questions
armGroupLabels: AF Education and Weekly Phone Calls
Meditation and Education and Phone Calls

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline Atrial Fibrillation Symptom Burden and Symptom Severity Scores
primaryOutcomes.description: Atrial Fibrillation Burden and Symptom Severity will be calculated from the patient-completed responses on the Atrial Fibrillation Symptom Severity Scale-Symptom Burden can range from 3.25 (minimally bothersome) to 30 (continuous symptomatic episodes) and is based on event frequency (1-10), duration (1.25-10), and global episode (1-10). Symptom severity is based on symptom specific subscale with range from 0(no symptoms) to 35 (severe symptoms).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in AF Quality of Life Score
primaryOutcomes.description: Quality of Life will be assessed using a patient completed questionnaire, Atrial Fibrillation Effect on Quality of Life Questionnaire. The AFEQT score is a combined score of 21 items (21-100) with a higher score representing greater QOL.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change from Baseline in AF Quality of Life Score

secondaryOutcomes.description: Anxiety will be measured using the Cardiac Anxiety Questionnaire with a calculated score (0-72) and higher scores indicate greater heart focused anxiety.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Individuals with Symptomatic Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation
2. A symptomatic episode of PAF within last 6 months
3. 18 years old or greater
4. Able to read and understand English
5. Able to participate in weekly phone calls
6. Able to attend two video visit/phone sessions that are 6 weeks apart

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Diagnosed with low cardiac function (NYHA Class IV)
2. Life expectancy of less than 6 months
3. Hospitalized in prior 3 months for illness other than PAF
4. Previously practiced mindfulness
5. Cognitive impairment
